overview:
Ian Weston helps companies find and build mobile business solutions.

After a period building aerospace control and training systems for agencies including the UK MoD, ESA, Inmarsat and Eumetsat, Ian Weston joined Psion and was one of the original management team when Symbian was formed in 1998.

At Symbian, he was responsible within the software engineering department for establishing structured project management approaches, including supplier selection and management, and eventually ran the delivery programmes for Symbian OS. Transferring to an outward-facing role, he then set up and ran the licensing arrangements for Symbian’s 300 technology partners, providing technical consultancy and training, while running the application developer support forums and Symbian Press.

After leaving Symbian in 2005 he founded and co-founded a series of technical consultancy businesses focusing on mobile and covering technical training and accreditation, contract middleware development, mobile app development and mobile web services and products.

He is currently active in the digital media space concentrating on mobile advertising and marketing solutions.
